meanings.definition: Not able to be corrected or rectified.
meanings.sent1: The mistake was uncorrectable, and there was nothing we could do to fix it.
meanings.sent2: The uncorrectable error in the document made it impossible to submit.
meanings.sent3: The uncorrectable typo in the email caused quite a confusion among the recipients.
meanings.sent4: Her uncorrectable habit of procrastination always led to missed deadlines.
meanings.sent5: The uncorrectable damage to the painting was a heartbreaking loss for the artist.

meanings.definition: Incapable of being fixed or amended.
meanings.sent1: The uncorrectable issue with the car engine required a complete replacement.
meanings.sent2: The uncorrectable flaw in the design of the building posed a serious safety risk.
meanings.sent3: His uncorrectable stubbornness often led to unnecessary arguments.
meanings.sent4: The uncorrectable crack in the vase symbolized the irreparable damage.
meanings.sent5: The uncorrectable error in the software caused a major system failure.
